GoalDescription: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Enhance traditional agricultural practices, focusing on disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation
IndicatorDescription: Proportion of farmers involved in integrated farming practices
ComputationMethod: Number of farmers involved in integrated farming practices divided by total number of farmers multiply by 100
Concept: This include income from crop production, livestock production, fisheries and aquaculture production, and from forestry production.
DataSource: Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries, Forestry and Biosecurity.
Definition: Integrated Farming practise is a whole farm  system which aims to deliver more sustainable agriculture
Dissaggregation:
* types of farmers
* Area Council level
* Provincial Level
* National Level
IndicatorShortName: Integrated Farming Practices in Productive Sector
Rationale: It is a dynamic approach which can be applied to any farming system around the world. It involves attention to detail and continuous improvement in all areas of a farming business through informed management processes. Integrated Farming combines the best of modern tools and technologies with traditional practices according to a given site and situation
